meanings.definition: The state or quality of being fast or quick.
meanings.sent1: His fastnesses in running races always impressed his friends.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah's fastnesses allowed it to catch its prey easily.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's fastnesses in gathering nuts were unmatched in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her fastnesses in solving puzzles made her the champion of the game.
meanings.sent5: The fastnesses of the rabbit's movements amazed the onlookers.

meanings.sent1: The castle was a fastnesses for the royal family during times of war.
meanings.sent2: The mountain cave served as a fastnesses for the hikers during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The treehouse became the children's secret fastnesses for their adventures.
meanings.sent4: The fortress stood as a fastnesses against any enemy invasion.
meanings.sent5: The bunker was a fastnesses for the soldiers during the battle.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The fastnesses of the metal made it ideal for building sturdy structures.
meanings.sent2: The fastnesses of the rope ensured the safety of the climbers.
meanings.sent3: The fastnesses of the shield protected the warrior in the heat of battle.
meanings.sent4: The fastnesses of the dam prevented the river from flooding the town.
meanings.sent5: The fastnesses of the armor shielded the knight from the enemy's attacks.
